DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether there is a difference in corneal epithelial healing rate and/or toxicity following pterygium excision, between eyes treated post-operatively by moxifloxacin(VIGAMOX)versus gatifloxacin (ZYMAR).
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Moxifloxacin Versus Gatifloxacin on Corneal Epithelium Following Pterygium Excision
DOC.criteria: 1. diagnosis of primary pterygium with a clinical indication for surgery 2. informed consent 1. known allergic reaction to fluoroquinolones. 2. secondary\recurrent pterygium or clinical suspected conjunctival tumor. 3. eye surgery in the last 6 months. 4. eye disorders: severe dry eye syndrome, ocular surface diseases, glaucoma, recurrent corneal erosions, chronic corneal diseases, after chemical burn. 5. low compliance. 6. pregnancy
